column2: Okay, pick a card, any card. (Monica picks one) All right, now memorize\nit. Show to everybody. Got it?'
Um-mm.'
All right, give it back to me. (takes the card back, but he looks at the\ncard before he puts it back in the deck, he holds the deck to his forehead, and thinks a\nlittle while) 5 of hearts.'
Real magic does exist.'
Wow.'
Wow. Joey, (sarcastically) how do you do it?'
I can\xc2\x92t tell you that, no.'
Ah, somebody\xc2\x92s at the door on the ceiling.'
Noo, that\xc2\x92s our unbelievably loud upstairs neighbor.'
He took up the carpet, and now you can hear everything.'
Why don\xc2\x92t you go up there and ask him to \xc2\x91step lightly,\nplease?\xc2\x92'
I have like five times, but the guy is so charming, that I go up there\nto yell and then I end up apologizing to him.'
Ooh, that is silly. (gets up) I\xc2\x92ll go up there, I\xc2\x92ll tell him\nto keep it down.'
All right, be my guest.'
Good luck.'

All right, all right, all right, all right, all right, you really wanna
know how I did it, I\xc2\x92ll show ya. When you handed me back the card, what you
didn\xc2\x92t see was, I looked at it so fast that it was invisible to the naked eye. (picks
up a card and quickly looks at it) I just did it. (does it again) I just did it, again.
Here, I\xc2\x92ll slow it down so that you guys can see it. (looks and the card in slow
motion)'
Oh, I got it.'
(muffled through the floor) Yeah, look I was with my friend downstairs\nand we hear everything up here that you do, and I am sick and tired... (I tired but the\nrest is unintelligible).'
(muffled) Whoa, you are very beautiful.'
(muffled) Oh, thank you.'
(entering) Hey, anybody got a length of rope about six feet long with\na little nouse at the end?'
Honey, what\xc2\x92s the matter?'
I just saw Janice. '
Oh.'
Yeah, she was at Rockefeller Center skating with her husband, she\nlooked so happy. I almost feel bad for whipping that kid\xc2\x92s pretzel at them.'
Man, I remember the first time I saw that girl Katherine, after we broke\nup. She was just walking with her friend Donna, just laughing and talking. God, it killed\nme.'
Yes, but you ended up having sex with both of them that afternoon.'
Sorry, I just, any excuse to tell that story y'know...."
Hey Chandler, there\xc2\x92s a party tomorrow, you\xc2\x92ll feel better then.'
Oh, y'know what, I\xc2\x92m gonna be okay, you don\xc2\x92t have to throw\na party for me."
It\xc2\x92s Joey\xc2\x92s birthday.'
Oh, well then, if anybody should have a party it should be him.'
Sush!! I cannot believe she is still up there.'
Okay, well he totally screwed up the punch line. Y'know, it\xc2\x92s\nsupposed to be arrghh-eh og-errigh."
(entering) How\xc2\x92s that coffee comin,\xc2\x92 dear?'
(jumping up from reading her magazine) Yeah, right away Mr. Kaplan.'
I\xc2\x92m not supposed to drink coffee, it makes me gassy.'
I know!'
I\xc2\x92ll bet your thinking, \xc2\x91What\xc2\x92s an intelligent girl\nwho wants to be in fashion, doing making coffee?\xc2\x92 Eh?'
Op.'
Eh.'
Oh, you got me.'
Well, don\xc2\x92t think I haven\xc2\x92t noticed your potential. Well,\nI\xc2\x92ve got a project for you that\xc2\x92s a lot more related to fashion. How does that\nsound?'
Oh, that sounds great.'
Come on over here, sweetheart. (they walk over to a storage closet)'
Oh thank you so much Mr. Kaplan, thank you so much.'
(opening the closet door revealing that it\xc2\x92s full of tangled up\nhangers.) I need these hangers separated ASAP. (she is stunned) You\xc2\x92re welcome.'
Oh God, I hate my job, I hate it, I hate my job, I hate it.'
I know honey, I\xc2\x92m sorry.'

Oh, I wanna quit, but then I think I should stick it out, then I think\nwhy would such a person stay in such a demeaning job, just because it\xc2\x92s remotely\nrelated to the field they\xc2\x92re interested in.'
(gives her a look) Gee, I don\xc2\x92t know Rach. Order up!! I got a\nYentel soup, a James Beans, and a Howdy hold the Dowdy!'

Oh honey, come on, I\xc2\x92m sorry, I didn\xc2\x92t.... I don\xc2\x92t mind\npaying my dues, y'know, its just how much am I gonna learn about fashion by walking Mira,\nthe arthritic seamstress, to the bathroom."
(to him) Hi! Is my misery amusing to you?'
I\xc2\x92m sorry, I wa, I wa, I was just ah.... (starts to laugh again)'
It\xc2\x92s not funny, this is actually my job.'
Oh believe me, I-I-I\xc2\x92ve been there. I had to sort mannequin heads at\nthat Mannequins Plus.'
Oh well then, so I\xc2\x92m just going to go back to talking to my friend\nhere. And you can go back to enjoying your little hamburger.'
Ah, just one other thing.'
Yes?!'
I ah, I work at Bloomingdale\xc2\x92s and I might know of a job\npossibility if your, if your interested?'
(looks at Monica) (to him) Do you want my pickle?'
(to Monica and Phoebe) Hey guys.'
Hey Gunther. Hi. (to Phoebe) I mean you\xc2\x92re going out on a date with\nthe noisy guy upstairs?'
Well, he\xc2\x92s very charming.'
I know, he\xc2\x92s too charming, but if you two start going out, then\nit\xc2\x92s just gonna make it so much harder for me to hate him.'
Well, you\xc2\x92re just gonna have to try.'
Joey, where are the Jell-o shots?'
I don\xc2\x92t know, Chandler is supposed to be passin\xc2\x92 \xc2\x91em\naround...'
Chandler!'
Hello-dillillio!!'
Oh, somebody\xc2\x92s feeling better.'
(to Chandler) Stick out your tongue.'
(to Monica) Take off your shirt!'
Oh my!!'
Oh my God! How many of these things did you have? These are pure vodka.'
Yeah, Jell-o just like Mom used to make.'
(entering, to Ross) The most unbelievable thing happened to me today.'
Hi!'

Hi! So I\xc2\x92m out having lunch at Monica\xc2\x92s and this guy starts
talking to me, and it turns out he works for a buyer at Bloomingdale\xc2\x92s and
there happens to be an opening in his department. So I gave him my phone number and
he\xc2\x92s gonna call me this weekend to see if he can get me an interview!'
Wow!'
I know!'
What, so this guy is helping you for no apparent reason?'
Uh-huh!'
And he\xc2\x92s, he\xc2\x92s a total stranger?'
Yeah! His name is um, Mark something.'
Huh. Sounds like Mark Something wants to have some sex.'
What!?'
Well, I\xc2\x92m just saying, I mean why else would he just, y'know, swoop\nin out of nowhere for no reason."
To be nice.'
Hey, Joey. Are men ever nice to strange women for no reason?'
No, only for sex.'
Thank you. (to Rachel) So did you ah, did you tell Mark Something about\nme?'
I didn\xc2\x92t have to, because I was wearing my \xc2\x91I heart Ross\xc2\x92\nsandwich board and ringing my bell.'
Uh-huh.'
(entering) Joey!!! Happy Birthday!! (all 7 of them look\nalmost identical)'
Hey!! Hey-hey-hey!'
(to Monica) Okay, how many of that girl are you seeing?'
How hammered are you? Huh? These, these are Joey\xc2\x92s sisters.'
Hi Joey\xc2\x92s sisters!'
(to one of his sisters, Cookie) Hey!'
Hey. What are we drinkin\xc2\x92 over here.'
Well, I have ah, vodka and cranberry juice.'
No kiddin,\xc2\x92 that\xc2\x92s the exact same drink I made myself right\nafter I shot my husband.'
Wow. Okay, I don\xc2\x92t know how to talk to you.'
(to Chandler) What \xc2\x91cha doing?'
Oh, I\xc2\x92m taking my ex-girlfriend of my speed dialer.'
Oh!!'

No-no-no-no, no, it\xc2\x92s a good thing. Why must we dial so speedily\nanyway? Why must we rush through life? Why can\xc2\x92t we savor the precious moments? (to\none of Joey\xc2\x92s sisters) Those are some huge breasts you have.'
Hi.'
Hi.'
Yeah. So um, I-I heard about this ah, Mark guy that ah, Rachel met today.'
Isn\xc2\x92t that great?'
Oh yeah! So ah, kinda pretty, pretty good. He sounds like a nice, good\nguy.'
Oh, he is. And he is so dreamy. I mean, y'know what, when he left I\nactually used the phrase, \xc2\x91Hummina-hummina-hummina.\xc2\x92 (walks away)"
That\xc2\x92s excellent.'
(to Rachel) So, he\xc2\x92s just a nice guy. You really think this Mark\ndoesn\xc2\x92t want anything in exchange for helping him?'
Well, I assume I\xc2\x92ll have to take showers with him, but y'know,\nthat\xc2\x92s true of any job."
How ya feelin\xc2\x92?'
Well, my apartment isn\xc2\x92t there anymore, because I drank it.'
Where\xc2\x92d you get too? We lost you after you opened up all the\npresents.'
Yeah.'
Yeah, I ended up in the storage room, and not alone.'
Woooo hoooo!!!'
Ow, no \xc2\x91woo-hooing,\xc2\x92 no \xc2\x91woo-hooing.\xc2\x92 '
Why, what happened?'
Ah, I fooled around with Joey\xc2\x92s sister. (Phoebe gasps) Well,\nthat\xc2\x92s not the worst part. '
What is the worse part?'
I can\xc2\x92t remember which sister.'
(to Rachel) You see what men do! Don\xc2\x92t tell me men are not nice!\n(points to Chandler) This is men!!'
Are you insane? I mean Joey, is going to kill you, he\xc2\x92s actually\ngoing to kill you dead.'
Okay! You don\xc2\x92t think I thought of that?'
How can you not know which one?'
I mean that\xc2\x92s unbelievable.'
I mean, was it Gina?'
Which one is Gina?'
Dark, big hair, with the airplane earrings.'
No, no, no, that\xc2\x92s Dina.'
(to Monica) You see you can\xc2\x92t tell which one is which either,\ndwha!!'
We didn\xc2\x92t fool around with any of them. Dwha! Dwha!'
Veronica. Look, it\xc2\x92s got to be Veronica, the girl in the red\nskirt. I definitely stuck my tongue down her throat.'
That was me.'
Look, when I\xc2\x92ve been drinking, sometimes I tend to get overly\nfriendly, and I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
That\xc2\x92s okay.'
That\xc2\x92s all right.'
That\xc2\x92s okay.'
(angrily entering, to Chandler) Can I talk to you for a second?!'
Hey, Joey.'
Hey. (they all walk away from Chandler)'
Come on!! (motions for Chandler to come with him)'
Why can\xc2\x92t we talk in here? With, with, witnesses.'
I just got off the phone with my sister.'
Ah, which, which one?'
Mary-Angela.'
Mary-Angela.'
Yeah.'
Y'know which one was she again?"

Why don\xc2\x92t you ask Chandler, \xc2\x91cause he\xc2\x92s the one that fooled\naround with her. She told me you said you could really fall for her. Now is that\ntrue? Or are you just gettin\xc2\x92 over Janice by groping my sister. '
It\xc2\x92s gotta be the first one.'
Really? That\xc2\x92s great! You and my sister, sittin\xc2\x92 in a tree.'
Yep, I\xc2\x92m in a tree.'
Did he call? Did Mark call?'
No honey, I\xc2\x92m sorry, but the weekend\xc2\x92s not over yet.'
Oh. (we hear laughing from the upstairs apartment) Oh my God, is that\nPhoebe?'
I guess they\xc2\x92re back from their date.'
Music. Very nice.'
Oh my God!'
So, how are you?'
I am good. I finished my book.'
Oh yeah, what\xc2\x92s it about?'
I don\xc2\x92t remember. Do you wanna take a walk?'
Yeah, I do. (they both run out)'

Dear Mary-Angela. Hi. How\xc2\x92s it going. This is the hardest letter
I\xc2\x92ve ever had to write. (to Chandler) What the hell\xc2\x92s a matter with you? How do
you think Joey\xc2\x92s going to react when he finds out that you blew off his sister with a
letter?'
Well, that\xc2\x92s the part where you tell him that I moved to France.\nWhen actually I\xc2\x92ll be in Cuba.'

All right, look, look, you\xc2\x92ve got to do this yourself, okay in
person. At least you know her name. You just go to the house and you ask for Mary-Angela,
okay, when which ever one she is comes to the door, you take her for a walk, you let her
down easy.'
What if Mary-Angela comes to the door and I ask for Mary-Angela?'
Where in Cuba?'
(shocked) Joey, what-wh-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-what are you doing\nhere?'
Waiting for my Grandma to finish my laundry. What about you?'
I\xc2\x92m here to see Mary-Angela.'

You are so the man! (motions him to come in, and he does) Now look,
listen, listen, you got to be cool, \xc2\x91cause my Grandma doesn\xc2\x92t know about you two
yet, and you do not want to tick her off. She was like the sixth person to spit on
Mussolini's hanging body. Yeah."
Where\xc2\x92s Mary-Angela?'
She\xc2\x92s right in there. (motions to the living room)'
Hey, Chandler!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe Mark didn\xc2\x92t call. It\xc2\x92s Sunday night, and\nhe didn\xc2\x92t call.'
Bummer.'
(to Ross) Yeah, right. Look at you, you\xc2\x92re practically giddy.'
No, I\xc2\x92m genuinely sorry the Mark thing didn\xc2\x92t work out. Look,\nRach, I want only good things for you.'
Wait a minute, why don\xc2\x92t you just call Mark. (they both look up in\nshock) I mean, who says you have to sit here and wait for him, you\xc2\x92ve got to make\nstuff happen.'
But, you, you don\xc2\x92t want to seem too pushy.'
(to Ross) Honey, it\xc2\x92s not pushy, he gave her his home number.'
(to Rachel, as she gets his number) What, he gave you his home number? As\nin like, to, to his home?'
Yeah, and you don\xc2\x92t mind if I call, because you only want good\nthings for me.'
That\xc2\x92s right good things, that-that is what I said. (glances at\nMonica)'

(on phone) Hello, Mark? Hi, it\xc2\x92s Rachel Green. (listens) Oh no,\ndon\xc2\x92t you apologize. (listens) Yeah, I\xc2\x92ll hold. (to Monica and Ross) He left my\nnumber at work, but he was helping his niece with her report on the pioneers.'
That is so made up!'
(on phone) Yeah, oh my God, tomorrow! That, no, it\xc2\x92s perfect. Oh\nGod, thank you soo much. Great! Bye! (hangs up phone) I got the interview!'
Yay!'
There you go.'
He even offered to meet me for lunch tomorrow to prep me for it.'
Oh, that is amazing!'
Yeah well, if I know Mark, and I think I do, I\xc2\x92d expect nothing less.'
I got to figure out what I\xc2\x92m going to wear.'
High collar and baggy pants say I\xc2\x92m a pro.'
Yeah! Right! Okay, I\xc2\x92ll see you guys later. (starts to leave) Woo\nhoo!'
You go get \xc2\x91em. (to Monica) What did I do to you? Did I hurt you in\nsome way?'
What?'
\xc2\x91Why don\xc2\x92t you call him?!\xc2\x92 Well, thank you very much!\nY'know now he is going to prep her, y'know prep her, as in what you do when you surgically\nremove the boyfriend!"
Are you crazy?!'
Am I! Am I! Am I out of my mind! Am I losing my senses!! This dreamy guy\nis taking my girlfriend out for a meal.'

What?! Ross y'know this isn\xc2\x92t even about you! I mean this is about\nRachel and something wonderful happening for her. I mean you know even if you\xc2\x92re\nright, what if he wants to sleep with her, does it mean he gets too?"
No.'
I mean don\xc2\x92t you trust her?'
Well, yeah!'
Then get over yourself! Grow up!'
(shyly) You grow up.'
This teramisu is, is excellent. Did you make it Mary-Angela?'
No! I did!'
Well, it\xc2\x92s, it\xc2\x92s yummy. So Mary-Angela do you like it?'
Of course! It\xc2\x92s her favorite.'
So um, Mary-Angela, what\xc2\x92s your second favorite?'
More of Grandma\xc2\x92s teramisu.'
Would you just please....give me the receipt \xc2\x91cause this is\ngreat. It\xc2\x92s top notch.'
That dies with me.'
So will I.'
Excuse yourself, and go to the bathroom.'
Oh no-no-no I was just squinting. That doesn\xc2\x92t mean anything.'
(whispering in his ear) Just do it.'
Will you excuse me I have to um..... (walks to the hall)'
(startled) Hey!'
Finally, I thought we\xc2\x92d never be alone. Can I just tell\nyou something, I have not stopped thinking about you since the party. (kisses him)'
Look, I may have jumped the gun here. (she tries to kiss him, but he\nducks it and moves away) Um, I just got out of a relationship and I\xc2\x92m not really in\na, in a commitment kind of place.'
So! Me neither! God, Mary-Angela was right you do have the\nsoftest lips.'
Ahhhh, you\xc2\x92re not Mary-Angela.'
No, I\xc2\x92m Mary-Theresa.'
This is so bad. If-if you\xc2\x92re not Mary-Angela, then-then who is?'
(standing behind Chandler) I am!'
Oh, this is soo bad. (doesn\xc2\x92t see Mary-Angela)'
Joey!!!'
No Joey! No Joey! Don\xc2\x92t Joey! Joey!'
What\xc2\x92s goin\xc2\x92 on?'
(pats him on the shoulder) You\xc2\x92re it! Now run and hide!'
It\xc2\x92s no big deal. Chandler was just kissin\xc2\x92 me because\nhe thought I was Mary-Angela.'
What?! How could you do that, how could you think she was Mary-Angela?'
I wasn\xc2\x92t sure which one Mary-Angela was. (all of Joey\xc2\x92s\nsisters gasp) Look, I\xc2\x92m sorry okay, I was really drunk, and you all look really\nsimilar.'
I say, punch him Joey.'
Yeah! Punch him!!'
Y'know what, we should all calm down because your brother\xc2\x92s not\ngoing to punch me. (to Joey) Are ya?"
Well, that is usually what I would do. But I just never thought you\xc2\x92d\nbe on the receiving end of it. How could you do this?!'

Joey if you wanna punch me, go ahead, I deserve it. But I just want\nyou to know that I would never soberly hurt you or your family, you\xc2\x92re my best\nfriend. I would never do anything like this ever again.'
So what. I say, punch him.'
Yeah! Punch him! Punch him!'
No! No! No! No, I\xc2\x92m not going to punch Chandler.'
I\xc2\x92ll do it.'

No you won\xc2\x92t. Look he knows he did a terrible thing and I believe\nhim, he\xc2\x92s sorry. But, (to Chandler) you\xc2\x92ve got one more apology to make, all\nright, you\xc2\x92ve got to apologize to Mary-Angela.'
Okay, absolutely!'
All right.'
You\xc2\x92ve got it. (he starts to look at his sister\xc2\x92s, but he\nstill doesn\xc2\x92t know which one is Mary-Angela.)'
Cookie, now you can punch him!'
What?! (Cookie punches him)'
(getting of the elevator and noticing Ross) Hey!'
Hi!'
What are you doing here?'
Ah y'know, this building is on my paper route so I... (gives her a flower)\n"
Oh.'
Hi. (kisses her)'
Hi.'
How\xc2\x92d did it go?'
Oh well, the woman I interviewed with was pretty tough, but y'know thank\nGod Mark coached me, because once I started talking about the fall line, she got all happy\nand wouldn\xc2\x92t shut up."
I\xc2\x92m so proud of you.'
Me too!'
Listen, I\xc2\x92m ah, I\xc2\x92m sorry I\xc2\x92ve been so crazy and jealous\nand, it\xc2\x92s just that I like you a lot, so...'
I know.'
Yeah.'
Yeah.'
Rachel?'
Yeah. (turns around) Hi Mark!'
Hi. I just talked to Joanna, and she loves you. You got it, you got the\njob.'
Oh, I did!'
Yes.'
(to Ross) Oh my God!! (she turns around and hugs Mark, not Ross)'
Congratu!! (sees her hug Mark) -lations-lations.'
So ah, Phoebe, how was your date?'
Oh well y'know. (laughs)"
Yeah, I do know.'
Ick, you were eavesdropping.'
Eavesdropping. Pheebs, the ceiling tiles were falling down.'
Oh, I\xc2\x92m sorry. But I really like this guy. And I think he really\nhappens to like me.'
Maybe he\xc2\x92s just jumping on a pogo-stick and really likes it?'
Maybe the pogo-stick likes it too?'
All right, that\xc2\x92s it! He cannot do this to Phoebe. (gets up) This guy\nis going to get the butt kicking of a lifetime! (stops and turns around and asks Rachel)\nBut, is he a big guy?'
Ah, we\xc2\x92ll all go. (motions to Chandler) Come on. (the guys leave)'
Thanks you guys! Thank you.'
Don\xc2\x92t worry.'
God, I hope they kick his ass!'
Honey, I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
Y'know if it\xc2\x92s any consolation, he really did sound like he was\nhaving more fun with you. (Rachel nods in agreement)"
(muffled) May I help you?'
